Our Department of Biomedical and Health Information Sciences prepares you for cutting-edge roles at the forefront of the healthcare arena.  Our innovative curriculum incorporates the newest ideas and technology, and constantly evolves to make sure our students leave prepared for positions as leaders in their field. Located in the heart of the Illinois Medical District, our students have access to clinical sites, professional associations, state-of-the-art facilities and a top-notch faculty with research expertise and real-world industry experience.    Stats and Facts      #2    U.S. News & World Report ranks our online bachelor's in health information management No. 2 among bachelor's programs with the highest six-year graduation rates               Our MS in biomedical visualization is the    2nd          oldest program of its kind and one of only    4          accredited graduate programs in North America              1st    Our online master's in health informatics is the first online graduate program accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education                  Biomedical Visualization Programs  With a curriculum at the leading edge of science and technology, our Biomedical Visualization Master of Science program attracts students from diverse disciplines, such as biology, art, computer science, and the health/clinical sciences. Our on-campus and online health information management programs provide skilled instruction in the collection, management and use of information in healthcare systems, and prepare you to take the Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA) exam.  NOTICE: The IBHE Post-baccalaureate Certificate in Health Information Management will transition to a Master of Science in Health Information Management in fall 2020, pending approval of the University of Illinois Board of Trustees and Illinois Board of Higher Education. Once the MS is approved, no new enrollments will be permitted in the certificate program. Currently enrolled certificate students will have the option to complete the certificate or change to the MS degree. Students completing requirements for either program will be eligible for the RHIA exam, but there will be a delay for graduates of the MS degree until the program receives CAHIIM accreditation, which is anticipated to be within one year of the first graduating class.
